author: hdmoadmin
title: It’s Game Day!
text:
5:15 am - October 02, 2015 It’s Game Day! 
TODAY’S TICKET : Booneville at Danville 
GAME : Booneville (1-3, 0-1) at Danville (1-3, 0-1) 
MASCOTS : Booneville Bearcats; Danville Little Johns 
WHEN : 7 p.m., Friday, Oct. 3 at Danville 
SERIES : Booneville leads 28-11-4 (0.698) 
LAST MEETING : Booneville 47 Danville 0 on Oct. 3, 2014 
LAST WEEK : Two Rivers 40 Booneville 34; Charleston 34 Danville 23 
STREAK : Booneville has won last 1 
FIRST MEETING : Danville won in 1920 
CONFERENCE AFFILIATIONS : Both are members of the 3A-4. 
THE COACHES SAID : Booneville is picked to 3rd the 3A-4; Two Rivers is picked 7th in the 3A-4 
BROADCAST : The Fort 94.5 and on the radio station’s website 
NOTES : If you look at the sideline tonight and think the Bearcats roster got thinner. If you mean in terms of head count rather than scale amounts, you will be correct. Seven members who were in uniform last week will not be this week, some by choice and some otherwise. 
Danville last beat Booneville in 1980 when future Razorback Brad Taylor was under center. 
THIS DATE IN BEARCAT HISTORY: Booneville is 8-2-1 in games documented to have been played on Oct. 2. The first two were losses, one an ugly 63-0 game to what is now Fort Smith Northside, but the last nine have all been wins except for the homecoming night tie with Vilonia in 1987. 
On Oct. 2, 1998 the Bearcats ran for 599 yards in a 42-0 win over Dardanelle. Zach Adair had a 90-yard run and 178 total, Travis Adair had a 74 yard run. Brandon Rowland had a 73 yard run and 125 total and Allen Ray ran for 166. 
Rick Ray had a four touchdown night with a 95 yard kickoff return and also ran for 159 in a 48-12 win over Waldron in 1970. Conway Massey — they were the first 1,000-yard duo — added 138 that night. 
On Oct. 2, 2009 Brock May threw for 176 against Subiaco, with 118 of those yards going to Jayson McKnight and the defense had 7 sacks in a 42-21 win. 
The Oct. 2, 1953 saw two punt return touchdowns for the first time. Henry Phillips, and Jimmy Earl Holcomb were the returnees. 
This date in 1981 saw Rick Musa and Mike Fleming run 69 and 65 yards for touchdowns in a 50-21 win over Atkins.
